fields.description:
This has been found to occur when looking at the UPM page in Admin, however any location retrieving the users from a group that has more than 100 users could trigger the error.

It is related to how Crowd, the library used by Stash and other Atlassian products to manage users, would return duplicated users in some circumstances (CWD-3628), while Stash would not expect any duplicates.

It is not a symptom of corrupted user data.

fields.description:
TL;DR allow me to enable a flag "disallow repository deletion"

When I try to delete a repository I get the following message
{quote}
This cannot be undone. All of the repository's contents will be irretrievably lost if they are not also stored elsewhere. All pull requests to this repository will also be deleted.
{quote}

This sounds dangerous and something that you don't want many people to be able to do.

At the same time we want to allow a user to create new repositories.

The closest thing I can see is to grant the PROJECT_CREATE permission but not the PROJECT_ADMIN permission. When I tried that it turned out that they automatically get the PROJECT_ADMIN permission on a repository that they just created (and thus permission to delete the repository).

Please allow an option to prevent a user from having permission to delete a repository.
An option to globally disallow repositories from being deleted would also work.
fields.summary: Allow control of repository delete permissions

fields.description:
It would be very useful for integration with custom build and release cycles if the REST API was able to create and delete branches and tags.

Justification:
One of our larger products runs to 300 repositories.  We use a script to branch and tag them all with the same names.  At the moment we have all our git authoritative repositories on a network file system so we can simply cd in and tag.

As we move to Stash however this becomes problematic.  Without API access to this feature it requires the user to have a local clone of all of those repositories.  If they don't you'd have to clone, branch/tag, push, delete.  A slow process over this many repositories.

We can't guarantee a developer has the whole system cloned as our build system is designed to let them only clone the parts they are actively working on.
fields.summary: Ability to branch from REST API

fields.description:
Cloning or fetching over SSH sometimes hangs when using putty or plink, which is bundled by TortoiseGit. 

Recent versions of TortoiseGit started shipping an updated version of putty, which occasionally sends a 

{{SSH_MSG_CHANNEL_REQUEST winadj@putty.projects.tartarus.org}}

request to the SSH server for diagnostic/optimisation purposes. The SSH server that Stash bundles does not handle this request correctly and the request is aborted or hangs as a result.

TortoiseGit have a [ticket|https://code.google.com/p/tortoisegit/issues/detail?id=1880] about this issue that describes a workaround (quoted below).

*Workarounds*

# Use the HTTP(S) repository URL instead of SSH 
# Configure putty to no longer send the winadj request:
## Run putty for windows 0.63. 
## Click on "Default Settings" in the Saved Sessions. Click Load
## Go to Connection -> SSH -> Bugs
## Set "Chokes on PuTTY's SSH-2 'winadj' requests" to On (instead of Auto)
## Go Back to Session in the treeview (top of the list)
## Click on "Default Settings" in the Saved Sessions box.  Click Save.
fields.summary: SSH operations hang when using PuTTy or TortoiseGit

fields.description:
We are trying to apply "fork" into our new work flow, and by reading STASH-3425 we noticed that, the "fork sync" only works when the fork branch is not diverged from upstream.

Which means, if a team in the fork updated a forked branch, they will have to manually "merge" the change through the stash UI, even though most of the time, there is no conflict.

We are thinking of it might make sense to have an option to enable auto "merge" capability for fork sync as long as there is no conflict? 

Not sure if this something already on the stash fork-sync feature road map?

Otherwise, we might need to write a plugin to get this process streamlined, just want to make sure we are not duplicate the investment here, :).

At the end, it is a great feature, fork-sync, and keep up the great work!
fields.summary: Enable unattended merge capability for "fork sync".

fields.description:
Similar to STASH-3820, the process() method could be interrupted by a .cancel() on the Git ExternalProcess.

We call {{Closeables.closeQuietly(out);}} in a finally block, which closes the outputStream (the stdin of the Git process). But if the Git process has been cancelled, this causes a "Bad file descriptor" warning. NOTE: I have not attempted to reproduce this, so this is a hunch - it's possible that the cause of this error is different to STASH-3820.

fields.description:
Currently it ignores the {{since}} parameter if the {{until}} isn't specified.

However, if we were mimicking things like {{git log}}, we would default the {{until}} commit to {{HEAD}}, which in a bare repo is the default branch.

fields.description:
This handler is called to interface with an ExternalProcess. ExternalProcess allows .cancel()ing the process, which will interrupt each of the threads that are running the input, output, and error handlers.

Currently GitSshInputHandler throws a RuntimeException on any IOException.

It is passed an org.apache.sshd.common.channel.ChannelPipedInputStream and calls read() on it.

If the SSH was interrupted, it throws an InterruptedIOException which causes the RuntimeException to be thrown. This case should be handled more graceful (it is currently adding noise to debugging a support case).

It causes log output like:

{code}

        at com.atlassian.stash.internal.concurrent.StateTransferringExecutor$StateTransferringRunnable.run(StateTransferringExecutor.java:68) ~[stash-platform-2.7.0.jar:na]
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.runTask(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:886) ~[na:1.6.0_22]
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:908) ~[na:1.6.0_22]
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:662) ~[na:1.6.0_22]

        at com.atlassian.stash.internal.scm.git.ssh.GitSshInputHandler.process(GitSshInputHandler.java:39) ~[na:na]
        at com.atlassian.utils.process.PluggableProcessHandler.provideInput(PluggableProcessHandler.java:135) ~[atlassian-processutils-1.5.10.jar:na]

fields.description:
This causes a potential NPE when .finish() is called before .cancel() (likely in a separate thread).

.finish() will loop, calling areOutputPumpsRunning() repeatedly, which does a 
{code}
        return (outputPump != null && outputPump.isRunning()) || (errorPump != null && errorPump.isRunning());
{code}

Since .cancel() nulls out the pumps, we can see NPEs when a context-switch occurs between {{outputPump != null}} and {{outputPump.isRunning()}}

fields.description:
When specifying inline-HTML in a markdown file (such as README.md):

Bookmark

The HTML element attribute ID is not rendered as in the following example:

Bookmark

This is critical for creating a HTML anchor that references an element in the same document. Such as: - [Bookmark](#bookmark)
fields.summary: Inline-HTML: Element-Attribute-ID  is Not Rendered

fields.description:
Repos on Github allow you to configure your local repo to fetch pull requests, as seen here: https://gist.github.com/piscisaureus/3342247

Here's what that gist lets you do:

{code}
$ git fetch origin
From github.com:some/project
 * [new ref]         refs/pull/1000/head -> origin/pr/1000
 * [new ref]         refs/pull/1002/head -> origin/pr/1002
 * [new ref]         refs/pull/1004/head -> origin/pr/1004
 * [new ref]         refs/pull/1009/head -> origin/pr/1009
...
{code}

To check out a particular pull request:

{code}
$ git checkout pr/999
Branch pr/999 set up to track remote branch pr/999 from origin.
Switched to a new branch 'pr/999'
{code}

Could Stash be set up to achieve a similar result? Right now I'm doing lots of copy/pasting of branch names when I want to do a git checkout on someone's pull request.

Thanks!

-John
fields.summary: Local checkouts of pull requests

fields.description: We would love to figure out stuff like who is doing pull requests, who is approving pull requests, how many pull requests are created, how many approved, how many are rejected, stuff like that.  If Stash can provide reports with these statistics that would be a great addition and this is vital info for big organizations.
fields.summary: Pull Request Statistics

fields.description:
- as a user, I have a repository in my personal project
- if you want to fork it and create the forked repository under a public project, no fork button is displayed

Workaround:

- if you append "?fork" to your repository URL (next to the repository name - take the "browse" out) you will be able to perform the action. So the only missing piece is the 'fork' button in the repository UI.
fields.summary: Cannot fork a repository from my personal project to a public one

fields.description:
It would be great if the pull request "commits" view included both commit data and diff data. My goal is to review a changelist commit by commit without having to open n tabs (n = #commits).

If this already a feature, great! Please point me to it. Otherwise, I think it's a pretty great idea and would make me much more effective.
fields.summary: Show commit diffs in Pull Request context
Show the SSH URL in the empty repository instructions
It's fairly fast!

fields.description:
# create a ticket in a project FOO, say *FOO-1*
# commit and push a change referring to this ticket in its commit message
# move the ticket to a different project BAR (assume that we get *BAR-2*)
# navigate to the list of Commits for the repository and click on the hyperlink for *FOO-1* in the _Issues_ column for the changeset you just pushed

Instead of redirecting me to *BAR-2* Stash presents me with a popup (titled "JIRA Issues") which tells me that it can't display the issue.

If I chose to open the hyperlink in a new tab or window using the context menu, the redirection works fine (This is what I also see when I enter the absolute URL to *FOO-1*: I get redirected to *BAR-2*).

*NOTE*: A Fiddler trace tells me that clicking the hyperlink in Stash uses the REST-ish API to interface with JIRA while opening the hyperlink in a new tab results in a request for the absolute URL to *FOO-1* which then redirects me to *BAR-2*
fields.summary: Redirection for moved tickets does not work for links in Stash

fields.description:
The following XML should create a repro:

{code}
    <web-item key="somekey" name="somename" weight="20" section="atl.admin/admin-settings-section" application="stash">
        <condition class="com.atlassian.stash.web.conditions.HasGlobalPermissionCondition">
            <param name="permission">SYS_ADMIN</param>
        </condition>
        <label key="plugin.page.repo.ci.info.tab.label">somelabel</label>
        <tooltip key="plugin.page.repo.ci.sys.info.tab.tooltip">sometooltip</tooltip>
        <link>/somepath</link>
    </web-item>
{code}

In an atlassian-plugin.xml which does NOT have a <component-import/> tag for PermissionService.  Furthermore, even explicitly component-import-ing the condition class doesn't resolve it.  If the condition class depended upon several beans, you'd have to trial-and-error determine each of its transitive dependencies and add them one-by-one.

A complete example of the bugged condition can be found here: https://github.com/palantir/stashbot/blob/7226bedc0ea5e886787a46a4b31125bdda418598/src/main/resources/atlassian-plugin.xml

In this revision of the file, I tried adding component-imports fort he condition classes but it just caused things to fail silently (and frustratingly), in stash 2.6.1 the plugin fails to enable.
fields.summary: When using Condition class in atlassian-plugin.xml, transitive dependency beans are not implicitly included

fields.description:
I was playing around with the backup Client Beta:
Nice, but if I think that we may host about multiple GB, maybe TB of Repository Data in a few months/years, a full backup of the Repositories will not be that nice.

As there is mostly a "backup" of GIT repos on client side It is not that really necessary to backup this. On the other hand I designed a filesystem-backup by doing snapshots on that partition to simply restore the GIT repos.
While excluding the Repos it would shorten the backup procedure as well as minimize the backup size. :)
fields.summary: backup-client: option to exclude $STASH_HOME/data/repositories

fields.description:
Building on the issue transition features added in Stash 2.7.0, it would be great to have (native) automatic issue transitioning with pull request. More specifically, allow related issues to be batch-transitioned when:

- creating a pull request
- merging a pull request
- declining a pull request

For a third-party reference implementation, have a look at the [Storyflow for Stash Plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.hindsighttesting.story-flow-plugin/versions].
fields.summary: Batch JIRA issue transitions with pull requests

Backup client fails if backup directory starts with same string as Stash home

fields.description:
In 2.7.0, user management has been updated to treat inactive users (users whose account has been disabled) identical to the way deleted users are treated. 

The queries that Stash uses to filter out inactive users have a {{WHERE active='T'}} clause, which doesn't work on Oracle databases. The problem is that the {{active}} column has been defined as {{CHAR(255)}} and in Oracle the {{WHERE}} clause doesn't match because the "T" values in the database are actually {{"T                         "}} (254 spaces).
fields.summary: Admin > Users returns empty user list for Oracle database

fields.description:
If the number commits in the specified range is less than the page size, the commit list is correctly truncated, for example:

https://stash.dev.internal.atlassian.com/projects/STASH/repos/stash/commits?until=f7fb48f&since=f7fb48f~2

However if there is more than a page of results, the 'since' parameter is ignored and the commit list will scroll all the way back to the root commit, for example:

https://stash.dev.internal.atlassian.com/projects/STASH/repos/stash/commits?until=f7fb48f&since=f7fb48f~20

It'd be nice if the commit list was correctly truncated. Customers have reported that they use these links to specify commit ranges in emails, etc.
fields.summary: Specifying 'since' and 'until' parameters on commits list only works if there aren't enough commits to trigger infinite scroll

fields.description: After creating a project and repository, the URL's are set to "http://localhost:7990" and not the base URL that was entered into the Stash Administration page.
fields.summary: URL's to identify project git settings are not correct

fields.description: Stash users with only read permission to a project or repository may approve pull requests, but declining or editing pull requests requires write permission.  That seems illogical.  Since declining or editing of pull requests is a common requirement for users who shouldn't be able to push to, or merge within, a repository (e.g. QA users), declines and edits should be a read permission.
fields.summary: Allow Pull Request Declines and Edits by Users with Read Permission

fields.description:
Two issues, but I believe they are related. We upgraded to Stash 2.7.0 and when you click on an issue from the "Commits" page in Stash, a popup comes up and says:
Can't display issues
Either you don't have access to view them or they don't exist. Please contact your system administrator if you believe this is incorrect.
instead of the integration I was hoping for. 
In Jira, when you click on an issue and then click the "Commits" tab, you just get the "To connect to Stash/Bitbucket/etc, click here!" message. 
However, the Source tab _does_ display Stash commits just fine. 
I have Jira & Stash linked to each other as Trusted Applications. I configured the IP ranges for both outgoing and incoming (the same IP range covers both servers). 
For the outgoing url list from Stash/incoming to Jira, per your documentation I put in the following:
/rest
/plugins/servlet/streams
/rpc/soap
/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest
/secure/RunPortlet

The Stash url list is blank; I can't find anything and a quick google has one of your support people saying to leave Stash blank. 

How do I get them to talk to each other? What do I have set wrong?
fields.summary: Jira 6 to Stash 2.7 Integration - not quite working

IE10 is available in Windows 8 as of August 2012 (see http://support.microsoft.com/kb/2718695).

nav-links and ref-syncing are not in the list of bundled plugins

fields.description:
Currently the extra shell makes it difficult to manage with process supervision and doesn't pass term signals down to java process.  

This works fine in other atlassian products.  A quick diff between start-jira.sh
and start-stash.sh show that the jira version just adds "exec" 

The local change i made was to update these lines in start-stash.sh
from 
{code}if [ -z "$STASH_USER" ] || [ $(id -un) == "$STASH_USER" ]; then
    echo -e "Starting Atlassian Stash as current user\n"
    if [ "$PRGRUNMODE" == "true" ] ; then
        $PRGDIR/catalina.sh run $@
        if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then
                exit 1
        fi
    else
        $PRGDIR/startup.sh $@
        if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then
                exit 1
        fi
    fi{code}

to
{code}if [ -z "$STASH_USER" ] || [ $(id -un) == "$STASH_USER" ]; then
    echo -e "Starting Atlassian Stash as current user\n"
    if [ "$PRGRUNMODE" == "true" ] ; then
        exec $PRGDIR/catalina.sh run $@
        if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then
                exit 1
        fi
    else
        exec $PRGDIR/startup.sh $@
        if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then
                exit 1
        fi
    fi{code}
fields.summary: Startup script should use exec so that it doesn't add extra fork

fields.description: I'd love at at a glance build status so we can take action quicker on broken builds blocking integration/merging rather having to click into every pull request.
fields.summary: Display build status on pull request list page

fields.description:
My team want to tag release commits. Once a release tag is created, the tag should not be able to be moved or deleted (except by authorized users/admins).

h4. Workaround

If you only want to prevent tag deletion, you can do this with branch permissions.  In repository settings, create a branch permission with a branch pattern of {{/refs/tags/*}} and select "Prevent Deletion".
fields.summary: Prevent moving/deleting tags

fields.description:
These currently are provided with "request" and "currentUser" properties, which is useful for the developer to have access to.

However, if they are passed through to the output, they cause errors, since "request" is not serializable to be sent to the client.

The error is currently opaque: "Error writing page-data output to String."

We should:
- stop throwing exceptions when pagedata has issues.
- Log a better error "Page data could not be serialized. Please ensure your context only contains serializable keys"
fields.summary: Better error handling of client-web-fragment ContextProviders

fields.description:
It's difficult to track in a large pull request what have been done and what still needs to be worked on. Allow the creation and handling of sub-issues in the pull request, like this feature in Review Board:

http://www.reviewboard.org/docs/manual/dev/users/reviews/issue-tracking/

The main advantage would be to have a very clear and visible list of the raised issues, and which ones still need attention (or were already closed).
fields.summary: Task list for pull requests

fields.description:
If you have fork of main 'project/repo' — 'username/repo', and create Pull Request from branch 'branch' into same branch in 'project/repo'. Then Pull Request name by default will be 'Branch'.

If someone else user fork 'project/repo' and create pull request into 'branch', him pull request will be also named 'Branch'.

After this stash will have two Pull Request with the same name. And email notifications from these pull request will connected into one thread in mail clients. This not very usefull to read.

Better to add repository name of forked repo into pull request:
1. 'username: Branch'
2. 'someoneelse: Branch'

Something like this
fields.summary: Set default Pull Request name from fork branch with fork repo name prefix

fields.description:
After creating an application link to JIRA, which has a URL like {{https://host:8443}}, all subsequent connections fail and Stash reports the JIRA instance as being 'offline'.

Workarounds:

1. Put JIRA behind a proxy on port 443
2. For internal and trusted networks only use HTTP

This was introduced in Stash 2.5.0.

https://bitbucket.org/lelik/atlassian-stash-deb/src/15746d63c675bf8058d4b3176804604e3ea39cbd/etc/stash/server.xml?at=master

https://bitbucket.org/lelik/atlassian-stash-deb/src/15746d63c675bf8058d4b3176804604e3ea39cbd/etc/nginx/sites-available/stash?at=master

nginx config for HTTPS:
https://bitbucket.org/lelik/atlassian-stash-deb/src/15746d63c675bf8058d4b3176804604e3ea39cbd/etc/nginx/sites-available/stash-ssl?at=master

In Server Settings URL of Stash Server is "https://stash.acme.com"

In clone popup show always:
http://user@stash.acme.com

Git does not handle 302 redirect in this case and fail on fetch/clone.
fields.summary: HTTP clone url used always HTTP scheme instead of HTTPS

fields.description:
When i am Using the Workflow Plugin an The Automerge Feature, i have the following Problem:

In the case that i have only selected one required green Build an no Reviewers in the Pull Request Settings then the Pull Request is not automatically merged when Jenkins tells Stash that the Build is green. I am not shure if i reported this on the right places.

best regards and thank you daniel
fields.summary: Automerge with Workflow Plugin

fields.description:
To reproduce:

* require 2 approvals for a PR to be merged
* without any approvals, dialog asks for 2 more
* approve
* dialog still asks for 2 more
* reload page
* dialog is now correct
fields.summary: Number of required approvals doesn't get updated when approving

I can't remove a repository on my stash. 
It's throw the following error:

Repository deletion was canceled.
Pull requests involving DEF/dbl could not be cleaned up. The repository may not be deleted.

What can I do to remove this repository?
fields.summary: I cant remove a repository

fields.description: One of the things we really liked about GHE was the ability to define the .gitignore file at repository creation time.  I can't see anywhere to do this in stash, and feel it's a nice feature to have.
fields.summary: Create .gitignore based upon language

fields.description: One of the things we really liked about GHE over stash was the ability to initialise a repository with readme file, so it can be cloned immediately.
fields.summary: Initialise repo with Readme

fields.description:
We told our IT department we wanted to try out an enterprise GIT server, they automatically picked GIT Hub Enterprise over Stash, simply because there was a virtual appliance that allowed them to deploy it really easily.

Providing a pre-configured virtual appliance would also reduce support calls from users trailing stash.  Installation would be:

1/ Download VirtualBox
2/ Download Stash Appliance

With little room for getting things wrong.
fields.summary: Virtual Appliance would make evaluating easier.

fields.description: It could be useful to have current user's (mine) Pull Requests, with filter on Open/Closed
fields.summary: "My Pull Requests" page

fields.description:
Is there any function to enable either an prominently visible in app or email notification when a (non-beta) upgrade of each product is available?
Most webapps these days include a version check against latest stable, yet I cannot anywhere in either stash or jira to do so.
fields.summary: Notification when version update is available?

fields.description:
1. I have installed JIRA v6.0.4, and used MS AD for authentication.
2. I also installed Stash v2.6.3, and integrated with JIRA.  and all users are come from JIRA.

Problem:

The JIRA and Stash could not be logged at same time (same account), 
For example: if l login JIRA by user test, then i login the Stash by same user test. then the session of test user will expire in JIRA. i have to login again, after logged, the Stash session will expire.

So The JIRA and Stash could not be logged at same time (same account),

Could you please give me some suggestion?

Thanks!
Br, Wayne
fields.summary: unable to keep login at same time(JIRA/Stash)

fields.description:
I sometimes need to check out a branch locally to review a PR. Clicking the branch name in the PR should highlight all of it so I can copy the branch name (similar to how the clone URL works).

See attachment.
fields.summary: Clicking the branch name in the PR should highlight all of it so I can copy the branch name

fields.description: Does Stash have any kind of reporting built in?  I would love to figure out stuff like who is doing pull requests, who is approving pull requests, how many pull requests are created, how many approved, how many are rejected, stuff like that.
fields.summary: Stash Reports for Pull requests and commits

fields.description:
Provide a UI that permits set a SQL Server instance name when configuring the database.

Alternative: Allow control of most of the JDBC URL.

h4. Workaround 
Modify {{stash-config.properties}} directly: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/STASHKB/Connecting+to+named+instances+in+SQL+Server+from+Stash
fields.summary: Add support for SQL Server instance names.

fields.description: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/199958/notificationhandler-import-error?page=1#199960
fields.summary: NotificationHandler and PullRequestNotification are not beans

fields.description: As a project maintainer, I may want to see if a pull request breaks the build.  In order to do this, it should be possible to add a pull request hook so that when a new pull request comes in, it triggers a build against our build servers to validate the incoming branch.  (note that this is one specific use case, but should lead to the ability to create pull request hooks, not generate a build from a pull request).
fields.summary: Introduce pull request hooks

fields.description: As a project maintainer, I may also be a programmer.  So there may be other maintainers (who have write access to the real master) that would merge in my changes.  I may want to use a pull request to satisfy code review checks, hence allowing code to be verified before being committed.  As a result, it would be a bad thing for me to be able to merge in my own changes.  It would be ideal if stash allowed an administrator to say whether or not a developer can merge in their own pull request, probably at the project or repository level (for example, for personal projects I may want to use a pull request to simplify merging).
fields.summary: Introduce configuration to block pull request creator from merging in their pull request
Enable Fixup functionality to Stash

fields.description:
Its desirable to have User-and-Group-multi-selector such as the one exists in BranchPermission dialog 
([...]/stash/plugins/servlet/branch-permissions/[project_key]/[rep_key]). 
The better practice (in my opinion) is to resolve it in accordance with branch-selector-aui (https://developer.atlassian.com/stash/docs/latest/soydoc/branch-selector-field.soy.htm), 
because both are similar, and seem to be used together.

Task created as outcome of Question 
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/193822/does-user-and-group-multi-selector-exist-as-soy-or-through-other-tool
fields.summary: Provide a user and group multi selector as part of the public client side API

fields.description:
I've been following the plugin tutorial, but for making a stash plugin: https://developer.atlassian.com/display/DOCS/Create+a+HelloWorld+Plugin+Project

I created the plugin with atlas-create-stash-plugin, and then tried atlas-run, but tomcat did not properly start, and caused an exception (attached).

The output implies that Tomcat has started, but in fact, I can't browse to it on the port given.
fields.summary: atlas-run does not correctly start tomcat in osx mountain lion

fields.description:
Coming from STASH-3751, recording the complete history of all administrative changes might be useful. 

Scenario:
As VCS person responsible I have to enforce several rules concerning repositories (for example certain hooks MUST be active). On the other hand each project administrator has the permissions to change those settings.
I / project-administrator would like to see easily who made when which changes on a certain project/repository.

Therefore an easy accessible history of administrative actions within Stash would be helpful ...
fields.summary: Log/History of administrative actions within Stash

fields.description:
Stash currently allows renaming repositories and projects. However if this is done, all users who have cloned the repository or bookmarked the web URL will have update them accordingly and get no prompt or information as to where it exists now.

Stash should keep a record of original project keys / repository slugs when operations are performed which can changed them. It could then provide a redirect in the browser amd output the {{git remote set-url}} command to use when attempting to clone/fetch/push to with an old url.
fields.summary: Allow historical aliasing of projects and repositories

fields.description: If there are branch restrictions on master, I want the people who have access to that branch added to the pull request.  It would nice for there to be a checkbox to add those people, rather than looking up who has access to master and adding them individually.
fields.summary: Checkbox on the pull request page: ‘Add users with permissions on target branch to review’

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of March 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#deebff|titleBGColor=#deebff|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi all,

I'm excited to share that in Bitbucket Server 7.0 we shipped redesigned and optimized pull request page with several improvements you’ve been asking us, including adding comments and tasks on any lines!

You can find more information in the Bitbucket Server 7.0 [release notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/bitbucket-server-7-0-release-notes-990546638.html] and Pull Requests [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/review-and-discuss-a-pull-request-808488540.html].

Please, don't hesitate to leave feedback on the feature in the comments. This will help us to priorities further development.

Anton Genkin
 Product Manager Bitbucket Server
{panel}

*Original request description*

After expanding the context of a diff in a Pull Request, you should be able to add comments on lines that are expanded, not just the original context lines in the diff.
fields.summary: Add comments on any lines displayed in a diff, not just the original added/removed/context lines
since and until parameters combined within REST API makes jira-key attribute go missing

fields.description:
Currently Stash only supports Stash, Bitbucket and GitHub submodules. Anything else will display as a normal file in the filebrowser, rather than a link. The problem is that Git URLs don't necessarily map 1:1 to a web page to view a repository, and so the mapping needs to be custom built. 

Are people often linking to external Git hosting solutions other than the above mentioned types? And if so would they like to be able to extend Stash (via a plugin or configuration) to transform submodules URLs?
fields.summary: Custom submodule URL handling

fields.description:
The code that handles merge conflicts runs into a NullPointerException in the ExitHandler for the ResetCommandHandler.

The {{reset}} command is only run for directory/file conflicts (one side of the merge has a directory where the other side has a file, both with changes) or rename/add conflicts (one side of the merge renames a file, the other side adds a file at the same location).

The error seems to only occur on some versions of git.

{noformat}
Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException: null
        at com.atlassian.stash.internal.scm.git.GitCommandExitHandler.isNonZeroExitCodeException(GitCommandExitHandler.java:153) ~[stash-scm-git-2.6.3_1375669598000.jar:na]
        at com.atlassian.stash.internal.scm.git.merge.ResetCommandHandler$ExitHandler.isError(ResetCommandHandler.java:71) ~[stash-scm-git-2.6.3_1375669598000.jar:na]
        at com.atlassian.stash.scm.DefaultCommandExitHandler.onExit(DefaultCommandExitHandler.java:34) ~[stash-spi-2.6.3.jar:na]
        at com.atlassian.stash.scm.BaseCommand.callExitHandler(BaseCommand.java:141) ~[stash-spi-2.6.3.jar:na]
        at com.atlassian.stash.scm.BaseCommand$CommandFuture.internalGet(BaseCommand.java:257) ~[stash-spi-2.6.3.jar:na]
        at com.atlassian.stash.scm.BaseCommand$CommandFuture.get(BaseCommand.java:224) ~[stash-spi-2.6.3.jar:na]
        at com.atlassian.stash.scm.BaseCommand.call(BaseCommand.java:78) ~[stash-spi-2.6.3.jar:na]
        at com.atlassian.stash.internal.scm.git.merge.MergeConflictHandler.flushIf(MergeConflictHandler.java:379) ~[stash-scm-git-2.6.3_1375669598000.jar:na]

fields.summary: Pull request merge fails if there are rename-add or directory-file conflicts

fields.description:
In our company we have several projects that are used in their subversion integration to have hook scripts that check the commit-comment to contain a jira-issue-id, some people "extended" them to make a specific jira-issue-id prefix as requirement.
As git uses on "server" side only push/pull methods maybe stash should be able to check the commit comments that differ from it's repository version to have jira-id's referenced and if not deny the push...
Anyway this case must be thought of precisely but my feature request may be clear now:

Please provide a way to require the git repositories hosted by STASH to contain a Jira-ID in it's commit comments. This feature shall be configurable per Repository (or Branch...)

We maybe can discuss the details here hopefully we can find a common sense to implement this feature request.
fields.summary: Make GIT Commit require a Jira-Issue-ID (configurable)

fields.description:
Please provide a way to integrate stash/git commits with Jira's time tracking. 
e.G. If you commit with Jira ID reference and a keyword like "worktime 2h" or "wt 2h" or simply "2h" it adds 2 hours to the estimated time of the task/ticket you reference.
fields.summary: STASH Integration with Jira Time tracking

fields.description:
Some of pull requests we need merge with 'merge.renameLimit=32767'. If we put this into global '.gitconfig', all pull request starts merge with such renameLimit. Sometimes it take a log time.

Will be nice to have per pull-request settings with overriden git config parameter for merge operations.
fields.summary: Ability to set config for Pull Request merge operation

fields.description:
Hi,

it would be nice to allow to approve a pull request even after it has been merged.

We are working in a small team. During holiday there is nobody for reviewing the code. So our lonesome programmer is merge the pull requests himself directly after creating.
After holiday I would like to check the diff and approve the pull request.
So I can see the nice little green icon in the pull request overview.
fields.summary: Allow Approval of PullRequest after Merging

fields.description: The main use case is for a pull request to merge a hotfix branch into master(following the pattern described at http://nvie.com/posts/a-successful-git-branching-model). After it's merged, I want to tag the merge commit in master with a version. I would like to be able to supply a tag name to apply to the merge commit when I click the merge button on the pull request.
fields.summary: Supply a tag to a Pull Request to be applied to the merge result

fields.description:
Hi Team,

Maybe this issue can be related to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/STASH-3308.

User faces the captcha reset error even after reseting the captcha.

To reproduce the issue please do these steps:

To create the issue, 

# Login to fisheye
# Go to admin panel
# Go to Repositories Section
# Click "Add Existing" 
# Walk through wizard typing in the details, as we also did for the working git repos (that do not require auth)
# Named it "JADM_GIT" (in git itself, it is named "jadm")
# Filled in Repository Location: https://eriks@mobiebay.com/git/scm/jadm/automation.git
# Git auth type: Password for http(s)
# Test the connection, and it fails with the CAPTCHA errors previously reported.   

* This has been attempted immediately after having the user enter in the CAPTCHA, same result.  Tried resetting their captcha via crowd, tried again, same result.
* Added our contegix user to the auth'd user list for the repo, tried from this different user (vs. eriks) and it produced the same error.  
* There are some existing git repos that they had no problems configuring/using, they live in the same git server, the only difference between the working / non-working is the fact the non-working requires authentication / a user.  
After these steps the error below is shown.

{noformat}
Exception executing command "/usr/bin/git ls-remote -h https://eriks:XXXX@mobiebay.com/git/scm/jadm/automation.git " Non-zero exit code: 128 com.atlassian.utils.process.ProcessException: Non-zero exit code: 128 Error executing command "/usr/bin/git ls-remote -h https://eriks:XXXX@mobiebay.com/git/scm/jadm/automation.git ": fatal: remote error: CAPTCHA required Your Stash account has been marked as requiring a CAPTCHA to be solved before you may login again. This is typically caused by too many attempts to login with an incorrect password. The required CAPTCHA prevents your SCM client from accessing Stash until it is solved, even if you enter your password correctly. If you are currently logged in to Stash via a browser you may need to logout and then log back in in order to clear the CAPTCHA. Visit Stash at https://mobiebay.com/git for more details.

Error testing connection.
Error talking to repository:

fatal: remote error: CAPTCHA required
Your Stash account has been marked as requiring a CAPTCHA to be solved before
you may login again. This is typically caused by too many attempts to login
with an incorrect password. The required CAPTCHA prevents your SCM client from
accessing Stash until it is solved, even if you enter your password correctly.
{noformat}

Regards,
Celso Yoshioka
Atlassian Support
fields.summary: Adding a Stash repository to FishEye fails with CAPTCHA

fields.description:
Hi team,

It was going to be great if Stash administration could disable the ability for users to add their ssh key to the server and only let admin add the ssh Key  on the server.

Regards,
Celso Yoshioka
Atlassian Support

fields.summary: Pull request missed from reference

fields.description: It would be really helpful for Supporters as well as customers to have this plugin bundled with Stash rather than to have it installed as a separate plugin. It would be good to have the features of this plugin being available in the product "out of the box", instead of sending customers on a hunt to AAC, marketplace or Support. It's already an Atlassian supported plugin.
fields.summary: Bundle Repository System Info Plugin with Stash

fields.description: In the PR overview I would like to be able to click on a file. I am looking at a comment and the PR author tells me it is fixed. I would like to drill into the file and see the fix by clicking on the file name or even the line number (I know it's outdated but it will be close enough).
fields.summary: PR: Click through to file view from activity

fields.description:
Our company could benefit from a way (within stash) to see the differences between any given branch head and/or any given tag.  This would be beneficial for our release managers that have not real reason to clone the repo as they are not programmers.  More importantly to them, would be the ability to see which non-merge commits were contain in the diff set.  For example:

Our release managers ask the question. "What JIRA issues were addressed in the 0.7.7 to 0.7.8 update?"  It would be nice if there was a way they could simply log into stash and generate that list for themselves.  If this list can be generated with a REST call, that would be icing on the cake.
fields.summary: Diff between branches/tags ability
